subsection_content:
If the frequency of nocturia is high but there is no timely intervention, the patient may face complications such as:
Neurological effects: Urinating 2-3 times during the night causes prolonged insomnia and poor sleep. Over time, the nervous system will be affected, memory will decline, and fatigue will occur when waking up in the morning.; Increased risk of heart disease: Frequent nocturia in the elderly increases the risk of blood pressure and cardiovascular disease due to having to wake up many times and interrupting sleep.; Long-term damage: Nocturia is caused by diseases related to the prostate, uterine fibroids, diabetes or kidney disease. If treatment is delayed, it can cause irreversible damage, seriously affecting health. .
